properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 12:18AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 1218 AM EST...a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line
extending from Flippen to near Milner...and moving east at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of these storms include
Griffin, McDonough, Covington, Barnesville, Jackson, Monticello,
Locust Grove, Social Circle, Oxford, Porterdale, Rutledge, Newborn,
Flovilla, Milner, Mansfield, Jenkinsburg, Orchard Hill, East Griffin,
Stewart and Turtle Cove.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3374 8360 3317 8364 3304 8429 3355 8415
TIME...MOT...LOC 0518Z 248DEG 31KT 3350 8416 3313 8426

WIND...40MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR BUTTS...SOUTHWESTERN MORGAN... SOUTHEASTERN WALTON...NORTHERN LAMAR...SOUTHEASTERN ROCKDALE... NORTHWESTERN MONROE...JASPER...EASTERN SPALDING...NEWTON...EASTERN PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN HENRY COUNTIES UNTIL 100 AM EST
